bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, May 21, 1901

div1.p: Sternberg recommends to the Adjutant General that Agramonte be relieved of his current duty and be directed to report to the commanding general, Department of Cuba, for re-assignment. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, May 21, 1901
div1.opener:
Agramonte
Communications on official business should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Contract Surgeon.
In reply refer to No. 38657.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, May 21, 1901.
To the
Adjutant General of the Army.
Sir:-
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that Contract Surgeon Aristides
Agramonte, U. S. Army, be relieved from duty as a member of the
board convened by paragraph 34, Special Orders No. 122, Adjutant
General's Office, May 24, 1900, and directed to report in person to
the commanding general, Department of Cuba, for assignment to duty.
It is requested that this order be communicated by telegraph.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, G. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
